description: Apparently from big +‎ -y, a suffix used to form adjectives meaning “having the quality of”, with an arbitrary middle syllable; compare uppity. Alternately, perhaps from big +‎ -ety, a suffix used to extend monosyllabic words; compare hot diggety, hippity-hop. Attested in the Southern United States since the late nineteenth century.

adjectives.description: biggity (comparative more biggity, superlative most biggity)

examples: “Aint you talking biggity. I bet you better not let your grandmammy hear you talking like that.”
